rm.requestResponse

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • rm.requestResponse.Component

  • public class Component
extends java.lang.Object
    Component realizes a connectionless message-oriented communication between two components of a distributed system, in other words, a request-response-based communication between two distributed components.

    It is not necessary to differentiate between the client and server role. Component automatically differentiates due the call order of send(Message, boolean) and receive(int, boolean, boolean).

    For performance reasons, requests (send(Message, boolean)) and corresponding responses (receive(int, boolean, boolean)) can be coupled. The coupling ends when setting the "complete" flag of send(Message, boolean) or receive(int, boolean, boolean). After a completed send or receive, the used port is immediately available, e.g. a server is able to react to other clients.

    receive(int, boolean, boolean) can be used in a blocking and non-blocking manner. A non-blocking receive immediately returns directly after the call, eventually with an empty return value.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Rainer Mueller

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(Message message,
        boolean complete)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent to the sender, which is specified within the message.
        complete - Complete coupled requests and responses to quickly release the used port. Incomplete send calls block the port, but are more efficient. true: complete, false: incomplete
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receive

        public Message receive(int port,
              boolean blocking,
              boolean complete)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        port - The port to listen to incoming messages
        blocking - A non-blocking call immediately returns. true: blocking, false: non-blocking
        complete - Complete coupled requests and responses to quickly release the used port. Incomplete send calls block the port, but are more efficient. true: complete, false: incomplete
        Returns:
        Message Message received from the sender or null (e.g. non-blocking call).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
